intro: Dyschoriste keniensis subsp. keniensis, commonly known as Kenyan dyschoriste, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and wetlands. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
